intro: Apinagia rangiferina, commonly known as the reindeer lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Cladoniaceae. It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its leaf-like thallus that is typically green to yellow-green in color. This plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in boreal and subarctic regions. Apinagia rangiferina plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing food for reindeer and other herbivores. Its slow growth rate makes it a valuable indicator of environmental health and air quality.
